TopicTitle: the next mod to become stock

Articles.Content:
(apologies to mods for posting in general but i think this is more general related in nature)

should be the new Infernal robotics 2.0 if you havent seen the video yet this is what KSP game play should look like as a builder of things (excluding realism, utility stuff) the quality of this mod is def release worthy

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yxh9En_Rd6E?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
I think we have had enough mods as stock.
Stock is nice but it takes away a lot from the mod dev. Instead of having your own schedule for updates additions your now stuck on the game updates timeline.

The next mod to become stock should be the load textures on demand mod

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/73236-WIP-Loading-textures-only-as-required](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/73236-WIP-Loading-textures-only-as-required)
If they added robotics to the stock game, then, finally, the game would be finished!

> 
> If they added robotics to the stock game, then, finally, the game would be finished!

^this

> 
> I think we have had enough mods as stock.

How about one more - KER? 

I can accept the reasoning for fun over perfectionism in creative, but with career mode and funds and the ability to lose the game, DV readout is absolutely ***essential***.

> 
> How about one more - KER? 
> I can accept the reasoning for fun over perfectionism in creative, but with career mode and funds and the ability to lose the game, DV readout is absolutely ***essential***.

yeah, and also for some people (me for example) fun lays in perfectionism =)

> 
> Stock is nice but it takes away a lot from the mod dev. Instead of having your own schedule for updates additions your now stuck on the game updates timeline.

and? mods aren't guaranteed to work and they usually end up become unusable with each update, there is nothing wrong with the game having stock parts that people can either keep or replace with mods
KAS\KIS is more essential IMO. I can't imagine building ships without winches, equipment boxes and Kerbals being able to manipulate obiects in game.

Assuming that any mod implemented as stock would be poorer than it was originaly, I want to see any/all enviroment enchansment mods.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-25T13:25:32Z" title="04/25/2015 01:25  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 25, 2015</time> by ddenis**

> 
> **Assuming that any mod implemented as stock would be poorer that it was originaly**, I want to see any/all enviroment enchansment mods.

cool story br0
KAS or mechjeb would be good in the stock game.

Kerbal Engineer Redux is essential, I agree. At least a minimal version that would show you your TWR and delta *v*. Also inclination of your orbit.

That's what basics of rocketry is all about. I'd never include MechJeb into the game. People, learn to fly your rockets. It's not hard and the learning process is what makes this game fun.

I agree, only mod that should become stock now is Load on Demand. Nearly everything else should just be left to be done by mods, as then people that don't want that mod or want to save on RAM can just not install them. Plus half these stock implementations of mods seem to be worse than the original mod...

> 
> KAS or mechjeb would be good in the stock game.

I believe mechjeb was essentially ruled out of becoming stock when the devs stated that there would be no automated pilot ever (don't ask for a source, it was a long time ago).

The problem with a thread like this is that everyone has their own opinion on what should be made stock, and you'll never get consensus. My opinion is the mod that gives you clouds should become stock, and KAC (mainly for the transfer windows).
The next stock mod should be Dynamic Warp. All I want for Christmas is 2 more levels of warp.

IR is nice, but as far a necessary, not really. KER or KAS add much more fundamental functions, KER more so probably. Especially if you consider it from the point of what mod do you rely on the most? Clearly the one that provides you with the information needed to get everything else to where it needs to be.
I hope the rest of KSPX is implemented, it has a stock style and it is very useful.

> 
> I think we have had enough mods as stock.

You can never have to much extra stuff ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Kerbal Engineer Redux is essential, I agree. At least a minimal version that would show you your TWR and delta *v*. Also inclination of your orbit.
> That's what basics of rocketry is all about. I'd never include MechJeb into the game. People, learn to fly your rockets. It's not hard and the learning process is what makes this game fun.

Everyone has their own definition of fun. You can't tell people what's fun for them.

How has nobody mentioned Kerbal Alarm Clock yet? Even in a much simpler format, without all the bells and whistles, KAC is probably the most vital mod I use. Not required, no, but it allows you to have more than a handful of missions at a given time. Throw some of it's functionality into a Tracking Station upgrade, it makes perfect sense.

I wouldn't call it essential, but some sort of implementation of something akin to KAS would be fantastic! It would give IVAs a true purpose and nobody can argue that it is unrealistic ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

As there is a [recent, open discussion thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/108890) regarding stock robotics parts, thread closed. It's a good idea, so let's keep the discussion about these parts to one thread so there's less repetition and confusion.

There have also been a fair number of general suggestion threads for integrating mods, but the developers' position has been that [it's not as easy as it sounds](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79071-Devnote-Tuesdays-The-0-24-Experimentals-Edition?p=1147237&viewfull=1#post1147237).
